result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert I D Kelsall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $150 bail applied, balance in 60 days, failure to pay 1 day jail for each $25 outstanding

Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
May transfer to Waukesha Co if accepted by Sheriff of both counties.

To be completed for a non-profit agency such as Center for Self Sufficiency, Sojourner Truth House, Advocates or any other non profit.
Completed by 10/31/2015 and written proof submitted to the Court and DA

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert I D Kelsall

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Paper exhibit destroyed as of this date:   07/15/2015 Trial
to Revoke Huber Privileges; copies forwarded to DA and Ozaukee County Jail
and proposed order to revoke huber privileges,   Scanned and forwarded to Br. 2
to Report to Jail
07/15/2015 Trial   Exhibits 2 & 3 WITHDRAWN    Paper exhibit destroyed as of 11/28/2016.

Defendant Robert I D Kelsall in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by ADA Wabitsch that offer to def was refused and wants that placed on record. Motions in limine reviewed. Statements and response by counsel. Court makes ruling. 9:17am Jury panel brought into courtroom. Jurors sworn. Voir dire by court. 9:29am Voir dire by ADA Wabitsch. 9:40am Voir dire by Atty Sulton. Striking of panel. 12 jurors called, remaining jurors thanked and excused. Panel sworn. 9:54am Preliminary instruction by the court. 10:00am Opening statement by ADA Wabitsch. 10:03am Opening statement by Atty Sultun. 10:07am Jury excused from courtroom. Statements by counsel as to clarification of opening statement. 10:09am Recess. 10:26am In session, appearances same. Jury returns to courtroom. State calls A. L. sworn & testified. 10:50am Cross exam. 10:56am Redirect. State calls Officer Stephanie Vasos sworn & testified.  11:05am Cross exam.  11:16am Redirect. 11:19am State rests. Jury excused. Defense moves to dismiss enhancer. No objection from State. Court orders enhancer dismissed with prejudice. 11:30am Recess. 11:45am Recalled, appearances same. Defendant advised of rights to testify. 11:48am Jury returns to courtroom. Atty Sulton calls Robert Kelsall sworn & testified. 11:53am Cross exam. 11:56am Redirect. Defense rests. 12:00pm Jury excused. Recess.  1:45pm In session, appearances same. Jury instruction conference. Defense moves for dismissal. Denied. 1:53pm Jury returns to courtroom. Court reads preliminary instructions. 1:55pm Closing argument by ADA Wabitsch. 2:10pm Closing argument by Atty Sulton. 2:14pm Rebuttal. 2:20pm Court reads final instructions. 2:24pm Jury excused to deliberate. Recess. 3:00pm In session, appearances same, jury returns to courtroom. CO identified as foreperson. 
Jury finds: guilty. Jury polled.Jury thanked and excused. State moves for judgment on verdict. Granted. Will proceed to sentencing, recess to allow victims to appear at sentencing.  3:40pm Case recalled, appearances same. Victims present in court. Recommendations by the State. Statement by Atty Sulton. Statement by victim. Court renders sentence.
Clerk informed counsel that this case will proceed as #1 trial on 7/15/15.
State's  Scanned & forwarded to Branch 2.

Defendant Robert I D Kelsall in court with attorney William Francis Sulton.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter remains on trial calendar. Motions in limine will be heard day of trial.
Request for adjournment of 6/17/15 by Atty Sulton is denied. Final status remains on calendar. Confirming email sent to parties.
